lines.content: November is a task management CLI tool designed to help users organize their tasks into three categories: **Todos**, **Deadlines**, and **Events**. This guide walks you through the features of November and how to interact with it.
2. Download the latest version of November.
Adds a Todo task to your task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Adds a Deadline task with a specified due date and time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds an Event task that starts and ends at specific times.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Lists all the tasks in the task list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Marks a task as done based on its index in the list.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Marks a task as not done.
Ok, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Deletes a task from the task list based on its index.
Got it. I've removed this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Finds tasks that match a keyword.
Searching for tasks containing the specified keyword: book
The task list is automatically saved to a file `saveFile.txt` in the `data` directory after every modification.
Upon launching the application, November will automatically load tasks from the `saveFile.txt` if it exists.

November is a task management CLI tool designed to help users organize their tasks into three categories: **Todos**, **Deadlines**, and **Events**. This guide walks you through the features of November and how to interact with it.
2. Download the latest version of November.
Adds a Todo task to your task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Adds a Deadline task with a specified due date and time.

Adds an Event task that starts and ends at specific times.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.

Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Marks a task as not done.
Ok, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Deletes a task from the task list based on its index.
Got it. I've removed this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Finds tasks that match a keyword.
Searching for tasks containing the specified keyword: book
The task list is automatically saved to a file `saveFile.txt` in the `data` directory after every modification.
Upon launching the application, November will automatically load tasks from the `saveFile.txt` if it exists.

// If task description and due date marker are not provided
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Please provide a task description.");
// If due date marker is not provided

// If there is no task description before the due date marker
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Please provide a task description.");
// If no date is provided after the due date marker
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Please provide a date after the due date marker.");
// If task description and event start marker are not provided

// If event start marker is not provided
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Please provide an event start marker.");
// If there is no task description before the due date marker.

// If event end marker is not provided.

// If there is no start date between the start date and end date markers.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Please provide a start date after the event start marker.");
// If there is no end date after the end date marker.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Please provide an end date after the event end marker.");
public static final String SEPARATOR = "____________________________________________________________"; // Separator line to demarcate output messages
public static final String TODO_COMMAND = "todo"; // Command to add a TODO task
public static final String DEADLINE_COMMAND = "deadline"; // Command to add a DEADLINE task
public static final String EVENT_COMMAND = "event"; // Command to add an EVENT task
public static final String LIST_COMMAND = "list"; // Command to list all tasks
public static final String DELETE_COMMAND = "delete"; // Command to delete a task
public static final String MARK_COMMAND = "mark"; // Command to mark a task as done
public static final String UNMARK_COMMAND = "unmark"; // Command to unmark a task
public static final String FIND_COMMAND = "find"; // Command to exit the chatbot
public static final String EXIT_COMMAND = "bye"; // Command to exit the chatbot
public static final String INIT_SENTENCE = "Hello! I'm November." + System.lineSeparator() + "What can I do for you?"; // Initial greeting
public static final String LIST_MESSAGE = "Here are the tasks in your list:"; // Message when listing tasks
public static final String LIST_EMPTY_MESSAGE = "Your list is currently empty."; // Message when no tasks are in the list
public static final String ADD_TASK_MESSAGE = "Got it. I've added this task:" + System.lineSeparator() + "  "; // Message when a new task is added
public static final String DELETE_TASK_MESSAGE = "Got it. I've removed this task:" + System.lineSeparator() + "  "; // Message when a task is deleted
public static final String MARK_TASK_MESSAGE = "Nice! I've marked this task as done:" + System.lineSeparator() + "  "; // Message when a task is marked as done
public static final String UNMARK_TASK_MESSAGE = "Ok, I've marked this task as not done yet:" + System.lineSeparator() + "  "; // Message when a task is unmarked
public static final String NONNUMERICAL_INDEX_MESSAGE = "Please provide a valid numerical index."; // Message for non-numeric index
public static final String INDEX_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_MESSAGE = "Sorry, but that index is not within the list."; // Message for out-of-bounds index
public static final String INVALID_INPUT_MESSAGE = "I'm sorry, I don't know what that means."; // Message for invalid input
public static final String EXIT_MESSAGE = "Bye! Hope to see you again soon!"; // Exit message
* The Parser class is responsible for interpreting user input commands
* and triggering the appropriate actions on the task list.
* Parses the user's input and calls the corresponding method based on the command.
* @param input    The input string entered by the user.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to be manipulated based on the command.
public static void parse(String input, ArrayList<Task> taskList) {
// Split the input into command and description if applicable
markTask(description, taskList, true); // Mark a task as complete
unmarkTask(description, taskList); // Unmark a task as incomplete
printTaskList(taskList); // Print the list of tasks
addNewTodo(description, taskList); // Add a new TODO task
addNewDeadline(description, taskList); // Add a new DEADLINE task
addNewEvent(description, taskList); // Add a new EVENT task
findTask(description, taskList); // Find a task by description
public static final String SAVE_FILE = "data/saveFile.txt"; // Path to the save file
public static final File saveFile = new File(SAVE_FILE); // File object for the save file
* Initializes the save file by creating the necessary directories and file if they do not exist.

* Loads the tasks from the save file into the given task list.
* @param taskList The list to populate with tasks from the save file.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the save file is not found.
public static void loadSaveFile(ArrayList<Task> taskList) throws FileNotFoundException {
Scanner s = new Scanner(saveFile); // Create a Scanner to read the save file
String line = s.nextLine(); // Read each line from the file
String command = line.split(" ", 2)[0]; // Extract command from the line
String[] todoData = line.split(" \\| ", 3); // Split the line for TODO task data
String todoDescription = todoData[2]; // Get the description of the TODO task
Todo todoTask = NovemberExceptions.validTodo(todoDescription); // Create a TODO task
taskList.add(todoTask); // Add the TODO task to the list
markTask(String.valueOf(taskList.size()), taskList, false); // Mark task if needed
String[] deadlineData = line.split(" \\| ", 4); // Split the line for DEADLINE task data
String deadlineDescription = deadlineData[2] + " /by " + deadlineData[3]; // Format the description
Deadline deadlineTask = NovemberExceptions.validDeadline(deadlineDescription); // Create a DEADLINE task
taskList.add(deadlineTask); // Add the DEADLINE task to the list
markTask(String.valueOf(taskList.size()), taskList, false); // Mark task if needed
String[] eventData = line.split(" \\| ", 5); // Split the line for EVENT task data
String eventDescription = eventData[2] + " /from " + eventData[3] + " /to " + eventData[4]; // Format the description
Event eventTask = NovemberExceptions.validEvent(eventDescription); // Create an EVENT task
taskList.add(eventTask); // Add the EVENT task to the list
markTask(String.valueOf(taskList.size()), taskList, false); // Mark task if needed
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid entry in save file."); // Handle invalid entries

* @param description The index of the task to mark.

public static void markTask(String description, ArrayList<Task> taskList, Boolean printMessage) {
int markIndex = Integer.parseInt(description) - 1; // Parse the index and adjust for 0-based indexing
taskList.get(markIndex).setComplete(); // Set the task as complete
System.out.println("Sorry, but that mark index is not within the list."); // Print error message for out-of-bounds index

* Deletes a task from the list.
* @param sentence The input sentence containing the task index to delete.
public static void deleteTask(String[] sentence, ArrayList<Task> taskList) {
int deleteIndex = Integer.parseInt(sentence[1]) - 1; // Parse the index and adjust for 0-based indexing
taskList.remove(deleteIndex); // Remove the task from the list
printTaskCount(taskList); // Print the updated task count
System.out.println(NONNUMERICAL_INDEX_MESSAGE); // Print error message for non-numeric index
System.out.println(INDEX_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_MESSAGE); // Print error message for out-of-bounds index
